BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 1600 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Fresh snowdrifts hard to spot, avalanches can be triggered even by 1 person in steep terrain, and reach medium size. Danger of naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches persists. Where snow is deep enough, they can reach medium size. Avoid zones below glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: By Monday morning 15-30 cm of fresh snow will have fallen widespread, with little wind, nonetheless brittle drifts deposited on leeward slopes, bonding mostly adequate but weak layers are possible inside the freshest snow. Snowpack is mostly stable but due to the weight-load of the fresh snow it can glide downhill over the warm ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: A bit of nocturnal snowfall on Sunday night (5 cm), winds will be light.On Monday, reduced visibility, minor snowfall possible, the N/E winds will be light. At 1500 m: -9 degrees; at 2000 m: -11 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

AvProblem.comment: gullies, steep bowls, behind discontinuities above treeline

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Evaluate steep, wind-exposed zones with caution, bonded snow is easily triggered
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 1600 m is CONSIDERABLE, below that altitude danger is low. Fresh drifts can be triggered even by 1 person in steep terrain, and reach medium size. Danger zones hard to spot, being blanketed by fresh snow. Poor visibility makes it harder still. Danger zones occur in all aspects, increase with ascending altitude. Loose-snow avalanches can trigger naturally in steep rocky terrain (up to medium size). Danger of naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches persists below 2300 m. Where snow is deep enough, they can reach medium size. Avoid zones below glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: By Monday morning 20-40 cm of fresh snow will have fallen widespread (most in the west), with only light winds, nonetheless brittle drifts deposited on leeward slopes, bonding mostly adequate but weak layers are possible inside the freshest snow. The base is stable, highly varied snowpack makes large-scale weak layers unlikely. The old snowpack base is still moist, due to the weight-load of the fresh snow it can glide downhill over the warm ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: A bit of nocturnal snowfall on Sunday night (5 cm), on the Main Tauern Ridge and in Lungau brisk northerly winds (40-50 km/hr) will be blowing, elsewhere only light winds. On Monday, reduced visibility, minor snowfall possible, the N/E winds will be light, on the Main Tauern Ridge and in Lungau blowing at moderate strength (30-40 km/hr, later slackening off). At 2000 m: -10 degrees, at 3000 m -13 degrees in the Tauern, -17 degrees on Hochkönig.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly. Caution urged esp. in wind-exposed steep terrain.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 2400 m is considerable, below that altitude danger is moderate, most danger stems from soft slab avalanches. Fresh drifts can be triggered even by 1 person in steep terrain, and reach medium size. Danger zones occur in all aspects, increase with ascending altitude, are often blanketed over and hard to recognize, exacerbated by poor visibility. In high alpibne zones it is possible that slab fracture down to more deeply embedded layers of the snowpack and grow to large size. Avalanches can trigger naturally in extremely steep rocky terrain (small-to-medium). Danger of naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches persists below 2300 m. Where snow is deep enough, they can reach medium size. Avoid zones below glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: By Monday morning 25-40 cm of fresh snow will have fallen widespread (most in the west), with only light winds, nonetheless brittle drifts deposited on leeward slopes, bonding mostly adequate but weak layers are possible inside the freshest snow. The old snowpack base is still moist, due to the weight-load of the fresh snow it can glide downhill over the warm ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: A bit of nocturnal snowfall on Sunday night (5 cm), in exposed high terrain brisk northerly winds (40-50 km/hr) will be blowing, elsewhere only light winds. On Monday, reduced visibility, minor snowfall possible, the northerly winds will be at moderate strength (30-40 km/hr, later slackening off). At 2000 m: -10 degrees, at 3000 m -13 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly. Caution urged esp. in wind-exposed steep terrain.

AvProblem.comment: near ridges, in gullies, steep bowls, behind discontinuities

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above the treeline is considerable, below that altitude danger is low. Fresh drifts can be triggered even by 1 person in steep terrain, and reach medium size. Danger zones occur in all aspects, increase with ascending altitude, are often blanketed over and hard to recognize, exacerbated by poor visibility. Danger of naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches persists below 2300 m. Where snow is deep enough, they can reach medium size. Avoid zones below glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: By Monday morning 10-20 cm of fresh snow will have fallen widespread (most in the west), with only light winds, nonetheless brittle drifts deposited on leeward slopes, bonding mostly adequate but weak layers are possible inside the freshest snow. The old snowpack base is still moist, due to the weight-load of the fresh snow it can glide downhill over the warm ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Hardly any snowfall on Sunday night, in exposed high terrain brisk northerly winds (40-50 km/hr) will be blowing. On Monday, reduced visibility, minor snowfall possible, the northerly winds will be at moderate strength (30-40 km/hr, later slackening off). At 2000 m: -10 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly. Caution urged esp. in wind-exposed steep terrain.
